author: Jovem Pan
title: Espanha envia refor√ßo militar ap√≥s inunda√ß√µes deixarem mais de 200 mortos
text: Fortes tempestades que atingiram a regi√£o de Val√™ncia nesta ter√ßa-feira (29) despejaram, em poucas horas, uma quantidade de √°gua equivalente √† que cai em um ano Cerca de 500 militares espanh√≥is uniram-se nesta sexta-feira (1) aos 1.200 que tentam aliviar a situa√ß√£o da popula√ß√£o de Val√™ncia ap√≥s as enchentes mortais que j√° deixaram mais de 200 mortos.‚ÄùSe for necess√°rio, estar√£o presentes os 120 mil‚Äù militares, prometeu nesta sexta-feira a ministra da Defesa, Margarita Robles, em entrevista √† televis√£o estatal TVE. ‚ÄúHaver√° todos os meios necess√°rios, o tempo necess√°rio‚Äù, insistiu o Minist√©rio da Defesa na rede social X ao anunciar o envio destes 500 novos militares, em um momento em que as autoridades da regi√£o de Val√™ncia parecem sobrecarregadas com a magnitude da desastre. As fortes tempestades que atingiram a regi√£o na ter√ßa-feira, que despejaram em poucas horas uma quantidade de √°gua equivalente √† que cai em um ano, provocaram inunda√ß√µes que destru√≠ram pontes, arrasaram casas e amontoaram centenas de ve√≠culos que dificultam o deslocamento dos servi√ßos de emerg√™ncia. Muitos desses carros ‚Äúest√£o vazios, mas outros, temos certeza, est√£o cheios‚Äù, disse Amparo Fort, prefeito do munic√≠pio de Chiva, √† r√°dio estatal RNE. Esta cidade de 16.000 habitantes, 40 minutos a oeste da cidade de Val√™ncia, vive uma situa√ß√£o dram√°tica, disse seu prefeito. ‚ÄúContinuamos pedindo √°gua, pedindo mantimentos‚Äù, explicou entre l√°grimas. ‚ÄúDevemos lembrar que h√° crian√ßas, idosos e sandu√≠ches‚Äù que n√£o conseguem mastigar, ‚Äúprecisamos de comida triturada para beb√™s e idosos‚Äù. As pessoas est√£o ‚Äúperturbadas‚Äù Aos problemas normais derivados da situa√ß√£o, somaram-se os saques, contra os quais o Governo prometeu firmeza e que j√° resultaram em 39 deten√ß√µes. ‚ÄúEu estava no corredor do shopping e as pessoas entravam para pegar roupas, estavam saqueando‚Ä¶‚Äù, Fernando Lozano, morador de Aldaia, cidade do interior de Val√™ncia, explicou √† AFP na quinta-feira. ‚ÄúAs pessoas est√£o perturbadas at√© que isso se normalize e o supermercado abra, est√° tudo muito ruim‚Ä¶‚Äù, argumentou. Solidariedade e um grande necrot√©rio A cidade de Val√™ncia, capital da regi√£o hom√¥nima e terceira cidade da Espanha , foi pouco afetada pela trag√©dia que atingiu seu entorno. L√°, foi instalado um grande necrot√©rio no complexo que abriga os tribunais, para agilizar a identifica√ß√£o dos corpos. Ambul√¢ncias iam e vinham, observou um jornalista da AFP, enquanto agentes de jaleco entravam no pr√©dio acompanhando macas cobertas com len√ß√≥is brancos. A √°rea foi isolada pela pol√≠cia e os jornalistas foram mantidos √† dist√¢ncia, sendo permitida a entrada apenas aos familiares dos mortos, aos poucos. Da mesma cidade, partiu nesta sexta-feira um ex√©rcito solid√°rio de centenas de vizinhos em dire√ß√£o √†s zonas afetadas, aproveitando o feriado de Todos os Santos para ajudar. Carregavam p√°s, vassouras, ancinhos, carrinhos de comida, fraldas, √°gua. Alguns atenderam ao chamado de amigos, outros apenas para ajudar no que pudessem diante de uma trag√©dia hist√≥rica. Publicado por Luisa Cardoso *Com informa√ß√µes da AFP

author: El Universal, Angelica Moreno Danitza
title: Descubre cu√°les son las verduras que pueden mejorar tu salud cerebral
text:
Descubre cu√°les son las verduras que pueden mejorar tu salud cerebral
Seg√∫n expertas, estos alimentos no solo mejoran la funci√≥n cerebral, sino que tambi√©n pueden combatir la depresi√≥n y prevenir enfermedades cognitivas
CIUDAD DE M√âXICO.- Un estudio liderado por la Dra. Uma Naidoo, directora de Psiquiatr√≠a Nutricional en Harvard, y la destacada neurocient√≠fica Lisa Genova, ha arrojado luz sobre un elemento fundamental para la salud cerebral: las verduras de hojas verdes.
Seg√∫n estas expertas, estos alimentos no solo mejoran la funci√≥n cerebral, sino que tambi√©n pueden combatir la depresi√≥n y prevenir enfermedades cognitivas como el Alzheimer y la demencia.
Las verduras como la espinaca, los berros, las acelgas y otras, contienen nutrientes esenciales que potencian la memoria y la concentraci√≥n. Pero su beneficio va m√°s all√°, ya que tambi√©n ofrecen una defensa contra enfermedades mentales.
Te puede interesar:
Tomarse un descanso extra los fines de semana alivia el estr√©s
Verduras que tienen potenciadores en el cerebro
Entre las verduras recomendadas se incluyen la lechuga romana, la col rizada, las hojas de diente de le√≥n, entre otras.
Los tres principales potenciadores presentes en estas verduras son la lute√≠na, reconocida por sus propiedades antioxidantes y su posible papel en la prevenci√≥n de la depresi√≥n; el folato, esencial para el mantenimiento de los neurotransmisores y la salud psicol√≥gica; y el betacaroteno, que puede impactar positivamente en la memoria verbal y cognitiva, seg√∫n indica la Dra. Lisa Genova.

author: User
title: The Foul Side of Social Media: Narcissistim, Negativity and False Sense of Safety Free Essay Example
text: 24/7 writing help on your phone Save to my list Remove from my list Social media is the use of internet websites and applications that let people connect to the world through sharing and talking. As of today it holds much power as a great majority of individuals use it in their daily lives. This isn‚Äôt good when it comes to the big amount of flaws and loopholes that allow it to land into the wrong hands. Not to forget how vulnerable some humans can be when it comes to sensitive stuff. Social Media has the power to unfavorably influence society into thinking a certain way that contradicts themselves and can lead to depression,anxiety, and insecurity. The rise of technology has led to the increase of social media and the many things an individual can do with it. From posting pictures, commenting on each other‚Äôs accounts,sending messages all that communication stuff, heck even knowing their location. The damage can be really done when those who struggle with mental health issues are negatively affected, as they are obviously more vulnerable than those who don‚Äôt struggle with it. Yet social media itself can also be the cause of these mental health issues society deals today as they seem to be increasing. The effects can be very long lasting and can be hard to get rid of and may interfere with an individual‚Äôs feelings and cause some kind of emotional distress. Now there is actual people who use social media as a way to upset or at times harm other people. According to ‚ÄúEffects of Cyberbullying‚Äù Cyberbullying occurs when a person uses the Internet,cell phones, or electronic devices to abuse another person. ..‚ÄùCyberbullied victims may develop feelings of sadness and loneliness and have a higher risk of depression‚Äù.Not only does depression make a person have a gloomy mood but can affect interests and future ones as well. This can fill up a person with negative thoughts about themselves and really develop something much worse. Social Media has to do with a lot of this as it gives the people power to do this by just having a phone. As you are just behind a screen and don‚Äôt know sometimes who‚Äôs behind the other screen. The effects of depression can be lethal especially when the person is not able to get the help to get him/her back up and they start really questioning themselves including if they should even live anymore.The fact some accounts are public can be seen by anyone, not to mention people sometimes hack into each other‚Äôs accounts. Which can stress anyone who doesn‚Äôt want their private data to be seen. It just gives an individual so much power to create so much chaos and affect someone so drastically to the point where they can just entirely close themselves. Anxiety is another effect that social media can have on somebody as they start feeling a little fear on what others might think on them, specifically when posting a picture or so. A social media addiction and anxiety can be unhealthy for someone as ‚Äúit can obstruct the relationship you have with your friends around you‚Äù, this coming from ‚ÄúWhy social media hinders real relationships‚Äù. Turns out social media can be a big distraction especially for Teens who go to school as,Blumberg from ‚ÄúAre our teens hooked?Social media addiction‚Äù states ‚Äúsocial media usage can be one of the major distractions from homework‚Äù.What is what happens when homework is incomplete or not done, grades suffer, and when grades suffer a Teen‚Äôs education overall suffers. Social media has managed to expose the inner bad in society. Not only making us feel vulnerable to each other, but making us feel like we need to take down each other down to boost our own inner-ego. It gives society a chance to say things they in person wouldn‚Äôt say specifically and yes I‚Äôm talking about the bad things. The feeling of being behind a screen gives us a feeling of security and feeling we can‚Äôt be harmed or seen. At times we are not ourselves and act as someone completely to our own person just to impress or seem more likable to others we usually don‚Äôt talk to. This is the insecurity issue social media leads to. Where people really have to think when posting a tweet or picture that is harmless but the idea of someone saying something negative or offensive about it gets stamped in our heads. Society starts getting picky on the way they dress,look and even talk. Leading to a very toxic reality where everything seems to be about money and fame and just because everyone is doing this...and posting this... people think this is alright. Things can get very out of hands when a person starts doing crazy stuff just to get attention from a certain someone or other people. The level of wanting more than they have can get into their head and start consuming them and can show in how they start to act around people,friends and family.All leading to a very bad domino effect of negativity spreading through people and just adding more wood to the fire. Social media can unfavorably affect society into thinking negatively about themselves which can lead to symptoms of mental health problems as they are consumed by themselves. Social Media‚Äôs effect on society seemingly is not good when it comes to the aspects of life being more connected through actual face to face conversations where emotions can be felt more.Not knowing a person could actually be someone else completely portrayed in their page. It gives a feeling of a fake reality where you don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs really happening behind the screen and if they are really meaning what they are saying. Not really knowing their life and if those pictures they took are really how they feel about themselves.It seems to create a fantasy and just shows what someone wants an individual to see. Social media lacks privacy can cause emotions that can drive users to the point of completely losing themselves and their identity as a person. üëã Hi! I‚Äôm your smart assistant Amy! Don‚Äôt know where to start? Type your requirements and I‚Äôll connect you to an academic expert within 3 minutes.

author: MENAFN
title: Blinken Calls For Avoiding Escalation In Lebanon, More Aid For Gaza
text:
( MENAFN - Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)) WASHINGTON, June 21 (KUNA) -- Secretary of State Antony Blinken called for avoiding further escalation in Lebanon on hand and also increasing aid to the Gaza Strip.
State Department spokesman Mathew Miller revealed that this statement came during Blinken's meeting with an Israeli official delegation.
Miller said that Blinken "also underscored the importance of avoiding further escalation in Lebanon and reaching a diplomatic resolution that allows Israeli and Lebanese families to return to their homes."
Blinken discussed ongoing efforts to achieve a ceasefire in Gaza and secure the release of all hostages, indicated Miller, noting that the Secretary emphasized the need to take additional steps to surge humanitarian aid into Gaza and plan for post-conflict governance, security, and reconstruction.
Earlier this month, Blinken was on his eighth tour to the Middle East since October 7, 2023 in an effort to reach a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip. (end)
